intro: Crocus annulatus, commonly known as the ringed crocus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of white, yellow, and purple. Crocus annulatus typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
